title: Fraction Division
text: To divide fractions, we multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.
speech: To divide fractions, we multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.
pacedSpeech: To divide fractions, we multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.

title: Reciprocal
speech: The reciprocal of , a over b,  is  b over a .
pacedSpeech: The reciprocal of  , a over b,
is   b over a

title: Reciprocal of the Second Fraction
speech: What is the reciprocal of  5 eights ?
pacedSpeech: What is the reciprocal of   5 eights

title: Multiplying Fractions
text: The next step is to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.
speech: The next step is to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.
pacedSpeech: The next step is to multiply the first fraction by the reciprocal of the second.

title: Determining the Sign
text: Since the signs are the same, the product is positive.
speech: Since the signs are the same, the product is positive.
pacedSpeech: Since the signs are the same, the product is positive.

title: Multiplying Fractions
text: To multiply fractions, we multiply the numerators and the denominators. So the numerator is $$3\times8$$ and the denominator is $$4\times5$$. The next step is to simplify the fraction if possible.
speech: To multiply fractions, we multiply the numerators and the denominators. So the numerator is , 3 times 8  and the denominator is  4 times 5 . The next step is to simplify the fraction if possible.
pacedSpeech: To multiply fractions, we multiply the numerators and the denominators. So the numerator is  , 3 times 8
and the denominator is   4 times 5
. The next step is to simplify the fraction if possible.

title: Checking for Common Factors
text: Do $$3\times8$$ and $$4\times5$$ have any common factors?
speech: Do , 3 times 8  and  4 times 5  have any common factors?
pacedSpeech: Do  , 3 times 8
and   4 times 5
have any common factors?

title: Common Factors
text: We will rewrite $$3\times8$$ and $$4\times5$$ as the product of primes and divide out the common factors from there.
speech: We will rewrite , 3 times 8  and  4 times 5  as the product of primes and divide out the common factors from there.
pacedSpeech: We will rewrite  , 3 times 8
and   4 times 5
as the product of primes and divide out the common factors from there.

title: Rewriting the Numerator
text: What is $$3\times8$$ written as the product of primes?
speech: What is  3 times 8,  written as the product of primes?
pacedSpeech: What is   3 times 8,
written as the product of primes?

title: Rewriting the Denominator
text: What is $$4\times5$$ written as the product of primes?
speech: What is  4 times 5,  written as the product of primes?
pacedSpeech: What is   4 times 5,
written as the product of primes?

title: Dividing Common Factors
text: We can now divide out the common factor $$2\times2$$ from both the top and the bottom, which gives us the fraction $$\frac{2\times3}{5}=\frac{6}{5}$$.
speech: We can now divide out the common factor  2 times 2  from both the top and the bottom, which gives us the fraction , fraction, 2 times 3, over 5,  is equal to 6 fifths .
